snippet: Thousands of runners learned Friday that the New York City Marathon had been canceled after a public backlash had mounted against putting on the race in the wake of Hurricane Sandy.
abstract: Runners who spent thousands of dollars on travel and several months training for the New York City Marathon express anger and disappointment over decision to cancel the race in wake of Hurricane Sandy.

byline.contributor: Mary Pilon, Steve Eder, Andrew Lehren and Ken Belson contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: Thousands of runners learned Friday that the New York City Marathon had been canceled after a public backlash had mounted against putting on the race in the wake of Hurricane Sandy.

headline.seo: Runners React to the Cancellation of the New York City Marathon
headline.main: Runners Express Shock, Anger and Relief After Months of Training
headline.print_headline: Reversal Of Course, Burst Of Emotions
